links.title: ITM to showcase 'large scale' hydrogen refuelling stations
links.description: Energy storage company ITM Power is to unveil a series of designs for 'large scale' hydrogen refuelling stations, capable of producing up to 20 tonnes of hydrogen per day. The new refuelling station designs, which will be launched at the Hydrogen + Fuel Cells North America exhibition in Las Vegas next month, are based around electrolyser configurations of up to 50MW in size.

messages.body: $TSLA https://cafcp.org/blog/renewable-hydrogen-transportation-and-energy-storage?platform=hootsuite

links.title: Renewable hydrogen for transportation and energy storage-and so much more | California Fuel Cell Partnership
links.description: ITM Power's chief executive officer, Graham Cooley, describes how hydrogen stations can provide grid balancing and frequency control services as the passenger vehicle market grows. In a recent letter to California's Public Utilities Commission, ITM Power discussed the significant role that renewable hydrogen can and will play in helping California achieve its climate and air quality goals.

links.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook Possibly in Austin to Make Announcement Tomorrow Ahead of September Event
links.description: Apple CEO Tim Cook is on work-related travel this week, and his trip may include a stop in Austin, Texas for a major announcement tomorrow. Tim Cook at Apple's Worldwide Developers Conference in June Public flight data shows that, on Thursday, a private jet landed at Austin-Bergstrom International Airport, nearly two hours after departing from Des Moines International Airport.

messages.body: $TSLA https://www.wsj.com/articles/teslas-push-to-build-a-self-driving-car-sparks-dissent-among-its-engineers-1503593742?mg=prod/accounts-wsj

links.title: Tesla's Push to Build a Self-Driving Car Sparks Dissent Among its Engineers
links.description: Elon Musk built a company that's more valuable than General Motors and Ford. Now, his ambitious goals for Tesla's Autopilot technology, the next phase in the rapidly changing auto industry, are being tested by resignations and disquiet in the engineering ranks.
